content:
Eric Huss said:

Will the public test be similar to 2018 where it was temporarily stabilized? Or is the current nightly unstable gate sufficient? If there is work to do there, it might be good to track that and who will do the work.

I wanted to break this question out into a separate topic. I had not anticipated doing that, I figured we'd advise people to test on nightly.

I also think nightly would probably be sufficient. I think the only snag is that users need to add cargo-features = ["edition2021"] at the top of Cargo.toml in addition to edition = "2021". I also think that should be fine, I just wasn't sure how smooth people expect the process to be.
I think that's sufficiently smooth myself
as long as we document it clearly

Public testing begins today!

  • @nikomatsakis will you be working with @simulacrum on ensuring the blog post is merged and the Tweet goes out?
  • We still have a few documentation PRs that we might want to merge before testing goes live.
That's the plan
@rylev FYI, the docs go through a publishing process on rust-lang/rust, so it has to go through the bors queue. I can update it today, but it can take a while to actually publish.
@simulacrum ping regarding the blog post PR :)
hm, we mentioned doc PRs -- are we blocking on those?
that's what I was waiting for
(those will take a nightly publish to actually go live after bors merge, too)
Let me take a look
Yeah, ok, I guess we might as well, I can alter the date to tomorrow
at least @Eric Huss's work on the transitioning chapter would be good to have
(those updates look great, Eric)
Is Mara taking a break? I can merge https://github.com/rust-lang/edition-guide/pull/258 if she's not around and nobody else wants to take a look.
I'm reading quickly now
I'm not sure of Mara's current status
lgtm, merged
https://github.com/rust-lang/edition-guide/pull/249 is stll pending edits but is a bt less criticial
@rylev are there other bits of doc you see as blocking?
It'd be nice to have https://github.com/rust-lang/edition-guide/pull/249 merged but I don't think it's necessarily blocking
I'm going to go ahead and post an update with what we have now. I think people will just need to be prepared for some rough edges.
I think we're more or less good to go. I guess we're waiting for tomorrow for the blog post then?
I can't promise it will land before midnight utc. I'll try to get the next merge slot.

Eric Huss said:

Is Mara taking a break?

yeah. i only told a few people, sorry. dealing with some heavy personal things. slowly getting back to rust and work and stuff now. might take a while before i'm back to full speed.
No worries :heart:

Exciting that this is happening! So far the upgrade process is a no-op for the workspaces I tried. I was wondering, for 2018 we had this fix --edition-idiom step that is not mentioned in the blog post (nor in the edition guide page on transitioning). Is that expected? Might be nice to quickly mention it somewhere for those people who remember the 2015-to-2018 transition?
I don't think we have any idiom lints this year
Documenting that is a good idea
not quite sure where/how it should be documented
